it.polimi.se2018.model

Class TestPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.model.PatternTest

  • public class TestPattern
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests the methods of the class Pattern. Also indirectly tests all the class Coordinates.
    Author:
    michelemarzollo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestPattern() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Initializes a grid of cells, some of which contain a die.
      void testCountEmptyOnEmptyPattern()
      Tests if the count of empty cells is 0 on an empty pattern.
      void testCountEmptyOnPattern()
      Tests if the count of empty cell is correct when some are filled with a die.
      void testGetters()
      Tests the getters of the class
      void testInvalidConstructorTooHighDifficulty()
      Tests the behaviour of the constructor with an invalid difficulty (higher than allowed).
      void testInvalidConstructorTooLowDifficulty()
      Tests the behaviour of the constructor with an invalid difficulty (lower than allowed).
      void testMoveDiceFailure()
      Tests if moveDice fails when invalid destinations are provided.
      void testMoveDiceSuccessful()
      Tests if moveDice acts correctly in a regular case where all restrictions are met.
      void testMoveDieFailure()
      Tests if moveDie fails when an invalid destination is provided.
      void testMoveDieSuccessful()
      Tests if moveDie acts correctly in a regular case where all restrictions are met.
      void testOnlyColourRestrictionPlacementFailure()
      Tests if the loose placement where only colour restriction are applied fails when a bad destination is provided.
      void testOnlyColourRestrictionPlacementSuccess()
      Tests if the loose placement where only colour restriction are applied acts correctly.
      void testOnlyNotAdjacentPlacementFailure()
      Tests if the placement where the placed die must not be adjacent to another fails when a bad destination is provided.
      void testOnlyNotAdjacentPlacementSuccess()
      Tests if the placement where the placed die must not be adjacent to another acts correctly.
      void testOnlyValueRestrictionPlacementFailure()
      Tests if the loose placement where only value restriction are applied fails when a bad destination is provided.
      void testOnlyValueRestrictionPlacementSuccess()
      Tests if the loose placement where only value restriction are applied acts correctly.
      void testOrthogonalAdjacent()
      Tests if dice are correctly placed when they form a cross-shaped pattern.
      void testPlaceDieAdjacentFail()
      If there are already dice in the pattern the next one to be placed must be near one of them (negative case).
      void testPlaceDieAdjacentSuccessful()
      If there are already dice in the pattern the next one to be placed must be near one of them (positive case).
      void testPlaceDieColourRestrictionFail()
      Method to check that if an orthogonally adjacent die has the same colour of the already placed one it can't be placed.
      void testPlaceDieColourRestrictionSuccessful()
      Method to check that if the restriction of adjacency are respected the die must be placed.
      void testPlaceDieNotOnBorder()
      Checks that when a die is placed on a grid that is empty, if it is not placed on a border an exception must be thrown (negative case).
      void testPlaceDieOnBorder()
      Checks that when a die is placed on an empty grid, if it is placed on a border the placement must succeed (positive case).
      void testPlaceDieOutOfBound()
      Checks if an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown when bad indexes are used.
      void testPlaceDieValueRestrictionFail()
      Method to check that if an orthogonally adjacent die has the same value of the already placed one it can't be placed.
      void testPlaceDieValueRestrictionSuccessful()
      Method to check that if the restriction of adjacency are respected the die must be placed.

      • testGetters

        public void testGetters()
        Tests the getters of the class

      • testPlaceDieNotOnBorder

        public void testPlaceDieNotOnBorder()
        Checks that when a die is placed on a grid that is empty, if it is not placed on a border an exception must be thrown (negative case).

        The die is not placed in a cell with restrictions, to avoid conflict of exceptions

        Checks that the exception thrown comes from the correct branch

      • testPlaceDieOutOfBound

        public void testPlaceDieOutOfBound()
        Checks if an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown when bad indexes are used.

      • testPlaceDieOnBorder

        public void testPlaceDieOnBorder()
        Checks that when a die is placed on an empty grid, if it is placed on a border the placement must succeed (positive case).

        Also checks that the placed die is the correct one

      • testPlaceDieAdjacentFail

        public void testPlaceDieAdjacentFail()
        If there are already dice in the pattern the next one to be placed must be near one of them (negative case).

        The dice are not placed in a cell with restrictions, to avoid conflict of exceptions

        Checks that the exception thrown comes from the correct branch

      • testPlaceDieAdjacentSuccessful

        public void testPlaceDieAdjacentSuccessful()
        If there are already dice in the pattern the next one to be placed must be near one of them (positive case).

        The dice are not placed in a cell with restrictions, to avoid conflict of exceptions

        Also checks that the placed die is the correct one

      • testPlaceDieColourRestrictionFail

        public void testPlaceDieColourRestrictionFail()
        Method to check that if an orthogonally adjacent die has the same colour of the already placed one it can't be placed.

        Checks that the exception thrown comes from the correct branch

      • testPlaceDieColourRestrictionSuccessful

        public void testPlaceDieColourRestrictionSuccessful()
        Method to check that if the restriction of adjacency are respected the die must be placed.

        Also tests the correct placement on a cell with the correct value restriction and with the second die in the border

      • testPlaceDieValueRestrictionFail

        public void testPlaceDieValueRestrictionFail()
        Method to check that if an orthogonally adjacent die has the same value of the already placed one it can't be placed.

        Checks that the exception thrown comes from the correct branch

      • testPlaceDieValueRestrictionSuccessful

        public void testPlaceDieValueRestrictionSuccessful()
        Method to check that if the restriction of adjacency are respected the die must be placed.

        Also tests the correct placement on a cell with the correct value restriction and with the second die in the border

      • testOrthogonalAdjacent

        public void testOrthogonalAdjacent()
        Tests if dice are correctly placed when they form a cross-shaped pattern.

      • testOnlyColourRestrictionPlacementSuccess

        public void testOnlyColourRestrictionPlacementSuccess()
        Tests if the loose placement where only colour restriction are applied acts correctly.

      • testOnlyColourRestrictionPlacementFailure

        public void testOnlyColourRestrictionPlacementFailure()
        Tests if the loose placement where only colour restriction are applied fails when a bad destination is provided.

        The state of the pattern after the failure must be the same as before, meaning that the failed operation left no side effects.

      • testOnlyValueRestrictionPlacementSuccess

        public void testOnlyValueRestrictionPlacementSuccess()
        Tests if the loose placement where only value restriction are applied acts correctly.

      • testOnlyValueRestrictionPlacementFailure

        public void testOnlyValueRestrictionPlacementFailure()
        Tests if the loose placement where only value restriction are applied fails when a bad destination is provided.

        The state of the pattern after the failure must be the same as before, meaning that the failed operation left no side effects.

      • testOnlyNotAdjacentPlacementSuccess

        public void testOnlyNotAdjacentPlacementSuccess()
        Tests if the placement where the placed die must not be adjacent to another acts correctly.

      • testOnlyNotAdjacentPlacementFailure

        public void testOnlyNotAdjacentPlacementFailure()
        Tests if the placement where the placed die must not be adjacent to another fails when a bad destination is provided.

        The state of the pattern after the failure must be the same as before, meaning that the failed operation left no side effects.

      • testMoveDieSuccessful

        public void testMoveDieSuccessful()
        Tests if moveDie acts correctly in a regular case where all restrictions are met.

      • testMoveDieFailure

        public void testMoveDieFailure()
        Tests if moveDie fails when an invalid destination is provided.

        When the method fails, the pattern state must be fully restored to the valid one it had just before the call.

      • testMoveDiceSuccessful

        public void testMoveDiceSuccessful()
        Tests if moveDice acts correctly in a regular case where all restrictions are met.

      • testMoveDiceFailure

        public void testMoveDiceFailure()
        Tests if moveDice fails when invalid destinations are provided.

        When the method fails, the pattern state must be fully restored to the valid one it had just before the call.

      • testCountEmptyOnEmptyPattern

        public void testCountEmptyOnEmptyPattern()
        Tests if the count of empty cells is 0 on an empty pattern.

      • testCountEmptyOnPattern

        public void testCountEmptyOnPattern()
        Tests if the count of empty cell is correct when some are filled with a die.
